WorkItem.Description:
From thread:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=51566
-----------
Default currency on my machine is numFmtId="44", but this is not defined in NumberFormat.php, so a read and write of a worksheet with one cell that is currency looses its style of currency.
I added 44 in NumberFormat and it did work.
self::$_builtInFormats[44] = '_("$"* #,##0.00_);_("$"* \(#,##0.00\);_("$"* "-"??_);_(@_)';
Â 
Is currency formatting supported in the reader?
WorkItem.Summary: True support for Excel built-in number format codes

Comments.Message:
A notable portion of questions/problems we are seeing are related to the Excel built-in number formats.

While Excel5 and Excel2007 reader does read many of the built-in format codes these are translated to user-defined ones during the read process. This is to account for PHPExcel core not supporting built-in number format codes (0-163).

This works ok except for e.g. some of the locale dependent number formats which do not translate to a unique user-defined equivalent string.

Is there some way we could incoorporate number format codes (0-163) in PHPExcel? I am aware this may not be easy!
We should think about this. May perhaps be a good one to pick up after the style improvement you are doing?
Erik, I'll pick this one up. Can you check after I've done my commit if everything works out with the changes you are doing?
I have not added all number format codes, but if they are added in the $_builtInFormats arrey, 2007 reader and writer should pick up thtat hose are built in formats instead of custom number formats.

This looks like a major improvement! I did some tests and read/write from template works better with dates. Before, it would happen that a date like '31-03-2009' would change to '03-31-09' after a plain read/write, but no longer.

PHPExcel only ships in one language version. Among other things this means that when you export to HTML or PDF dates and currencies may still not look like what you see when opening the workbook in MS Office Excel. I think you are right that we should wait doing more refinements until memory optimizations are in place. But now that built-in format codes have started to work ok imagination tells me that a locale feature request will one day come :')
